comment._content: She should have been sent to bed without supper, not hard labor!

comment._content: She probably wouldn't have had supper anyway.

comment.author: 21253275@N08
comment._content: Thank goodness, a light sentence.  She was probably already working six days a week. She missed only one day of rest.

comment.author: 53569869@N04
comment._content:
How dare she steal iron with her friends, trying to survive! Shame on her!
Seriously, soooo SAD!

comment.author: 29498828@N04
comment._content:
Ellen may have used her younger looks to lessen her sentence, as she appears to have actually been born near Houghton le spring around 1857. I suspect she was baptised in June 1862 and she subsequently took this for her birth date.
 In 1881 she is residing with the BOLD family in Westoe near South Shields She is registered as being a housekeeper and married but I cannot locate a marriage for her at that time. She in fact appears to marry David Whale in 1886 and continues to reside in the South Shields area until her death in 1916.
Any children should be shown in the 1891 and 1901 census.

comment.author: 98085731@N05
comment._content: Ah sweet little thing. Should have hepled the kid out not punished her

comment.author: 105226414@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/dixiedancer] I would have sent her to a warm bed after a huge dinner and desert!

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/21253275@N08] I suspect she worked 24/7, just to survive.
